title: Untitled Goose Game
description: It's a lovely morning in the village, and you are a horrible goose. How did four-person indie game studio House House create the anti-hero internet sensation that honked its way into our hearts in 2019? And how did a small-ish company on the other side of the world - one known primarily for making Mac and iOS software - come to be the publisher of that game?

title: Pantscast
description: Most of us remember the iPhone app store launch in 2008 and the iPhone app gold rush that followed. Indie developers flocked to the platform, all determined to build a breakout app that would earn them millions. And pretty soon that gold rush… turned into a brown rush. Enter Panic, with a ridiculous novelty app and an elaborate fake backstory for a German company that didn't exist.

title: Our Monogamous Follow Heart
description: An act of social media spite, an unlikely friendship, and a lot of fast food coupons. How did signing up for a Twitter account to do support lead to an odd and endearing relationship… and whatever happened to the cardboard friends we made along the way?

title: Audion & On
description: How did a fierce competition with a rival lead Steven Frank and Cabel Sasser to make a life-changing decision in a meeting with one of their biggest idols... and one of their arch nemeses?

title: Totally Sidetalkin'
description: How the Nokia N-Gage failed so spectacularly that it became a meme before social media really existed. And what that has to do with Panic, exactly.

title: “There are as many identities in Northern Ireland as people”
description: Zing’s reached the end of her adventure around the UK and it’s time for her to make a decision: does she want to give up her Singaporean passport for a British one? Has touring the country and having frank and difficult conversations about national identity helped her decide whether she’s ready to trade in citizenship of the country she was raised in for the one she calls home now? Before she answers these questions, she’s got one final stop to make on her tour - Belfast. Unfortunately, with the country still locked down due to coronavirus, Zing can’t travel there in person. However, journalists Jordan Dunbar and Ciarán Logue are ready to give her a virtual tour of the city, an introduction to its nightlife and slang, and some fascinating insights into British, Irish and Northern Irish identity. Ciarán teaches journalism at Queen’s University Belfast and he’s asked some students there to share their thoughts on what national identity means to them.

title: “Geordies - we’re a tenacious bunch of people!”
description: Something that still occasionally baffles Zing about life in the UK is the British sense of humour. Why does it often involve taking the piss out of the people you love most, or jokes about the bleakest things imaginable? This week Zing puts her questions to a professional: Geordie stand-up comedian, Louise Young. Louise tells Zing about the comedy scene in her home city of Newcastle, what Geordie identity means to her, and Title: “Geordies - we’re a tenacious bunch of people!” Short: Zing chats to Geordie comedian Louise Young Long: Something that still occasionally baffles Zing about life in the UK is the British sense of humour. Why does it often involve taking the piss out of the people you love most, or jokes about the bleakest things imaginable? This week Zing puts her questions to a professional: Geordie stand-up comedian, Louise Young. Louise tells Zing about the comedy scene in her home city of Newcastle, what Geordie identity means to her, and how she plays with regional stereotypes in her shows. how she plays with regional stereotypes in her shows.

title: “Glasgow’s creative, contradictory and rough around the edges”
description: Zing’s first trip to Glasgow has to wait because of the coronavirus lockdown. Luckily, Glaswegian poet and performer Kevin Gilday has the perfect antidote to Zing's cabin fever: a virtual tour around the places, culture and history of his home city. Kevin shares what he learnt about Scottish identity by writing his one-man show, Suffering From Scottishness, and explains why his accent produces different reactions around the world.

title: “Our patriotism is quiet and subtle”
description: Zing is in York chatting to student and political activist, Dominique Samuels. Dominique is the president of Orthodox Conservatives, a new conservative pressure group. Zing hasn’t met too many young Brits with conservative views and she’s keen to hear Dominique’s perspective. Dominique has Jamaican heritage and she and Zing discuss whether Britain’s imperial history affects people today. Plus Zing hears Dominique’s take on nationalism, patriotism and Englishness.

title: “Elbow deep in cow muck – and I love this!”
description: Zing heads to Lytham in rural Lancashire for a trip to Tom Pemberton’s farm. Tom’s the fifth generation of farmers in his family and he’s one of very few young people in the UK working in this tough industry. He’s also something of a farming influencer – his videos about the highs and lows of farming life get thousands of views. He tells Zing about nursing new born calves, chasing escaped cows and why Britain should be proud of its grass.

title: “This is British now. What are you gonna do about it?”
description: Zing speaks to poet and photographer Nabeelah Hafeez about what being from Bradford means to her and why the city’s arts scene is thriving now. Nabeelah feels that negative news stories about Bradford being a segregated city are exaggerated, but that doesn’t mean she hasn’t sometimes experienced racism and Islamophobia. Recently she was shocked to discover it very close to home.

title: “Speaking Welsh is vibrant and cool”
description: “People have had to really fight to keep the language alive, which is why it’s vibrant now”. Zing heads to Cardiff to meet Lisa Angharad, host of possibly the first ever sex podcast in Welsh – Siarad Secs. Lisa wants to provide young Welsh speakers with frank, open discussions “in the language they have sex in and have those chats with their mates in”. Lisa is also a singer and says that a love of music, singing and harmonising is at the heart of Welsh identity: “If you’re happy, joyous, grieving, whatever – music is something we gravitate towards”. She's proudly Welsh, and doesn't feel "an ounce British" - she tells Zing why.

title: “British drag is slapdash and hodgepodge”
description: When RuPaul’s Drag Race launched in the UK last year Zing noticed lots of fans saying the show made them feel strangely patriotic. The contestants were bawdy, slapdash, raucous and not as earnest or polished as the queens of the original American series. This week Zing’s heading to Birmingham - home town of Drag Race star, Sum Ting Wong. They discuss what makes British drag unique, compare stories of coming out to their Asian parents, and take a tour of Sum’s Brum.

title: "Maybe Liverpool isn't real, maybe we just dreamed it"
description:
Zing Tsjeng, Executive Editor at VICE UK, is on a journey around the UK trying to figure out what being British is all about. After living in the UK half her life, she wants to decide whether to trade her Singaporean passport for a British one. It's a tough dilemma as Singapore doesn't allow dual nationality and swapping the citizenship of the country she was raised in, for the one she calls home now, feels like a big deal. Can talking to people from all over the country about their national and local identity help her decide whether to take the plunge and become British?

Zing starts her great British adventure in Liverpool where she meets arts writer Laura Brown. Zing's heard that some Liverpudlians feel so strongly tied to the city that they say they're 'Scouse not English', and she's hoping Laura - who lives and breathes Liverpool - can help her get her head around this. Laura explains how Liverpool's rich and sometimes painful history, its underground arts scene - even its geography and weather - have shaped the city's sense of itself as defiantly different from the rest of the UK.

title: "Essex has given me my ballsiness"
description: Zing heads to Witham to meet self-described proud Essex girl, councillor Chelsey Jay. Chelsey was elected last year to the local town council at the age of 28. For Chelsey, being from Essex is all about being "ballsy" and ignoring snobbish stereotypes: "you're gonna be ripped apart for being from Essex so you might as well give it a try, with a smile on your face."

title: Welcome to United Zingdom
description: Zing Tsjeng, executive editor at VICE UK, can apply for a British passport. But there’s a catch. She’s already got one from Singapore, the country where she was born and raised, and she’s not allowed to have both – it’s either a British passport, or a Singaporean one. Before she makes a decision she wants to know: what does it mean to be British? So she’s going on a trip around the UK to find out.

title: #66 Hurt People Hurt People? Dealing With Hurt, Emotions and Healing (ft. Raj Mahal and Sophira)
description: Getting emotionally hurt is quite possibly one of the worst feelings to experience. We've all been hurt or have inflicted hurt on people but no one tells you how to heal, move on and learn from the hurt. Today, we got Raj and Sophira on the table with us today to discuss getting hurt, what to do we inflict hurt on others and how to heal.

title: #65 Are Millennials Afraid of Love, Thoughts on Dating Apps & Putting Yourself Out There
description: Dating apps - you're either on it or you're thinking of trying it. It has become an easy way for people to get to know each other without being in a social setting but do the cons outweigh the pros? Raj and Vivian join Ming Yue on this episode of Table Talk to discuss the pros and cons of dating apps, question if millennials are afraid of love and why you need a strong support group to when it comes to dating.

title: #64 Why Birthdays Lose Its Magic, Celebrations During MCO & Reminiscing Childhood Birthdays at McD
description: This special episode goes out to Ming Yue! He celebrated his birthday over the weekend so we got together to talk about what it's like to celebrate our birthdays during MCO and lament over how birthdays gradually lose its magic as we grow older. We also reminisce about our birthdays when we were younger and got sidetracked with finding out what happened to the OG McD gang. For real, what happened to Hamburglar and Birdie?

title: #63 The Curious Case of Entitlement, Sabotaging Your Business & Being Decent Human Beings
description: Yet again we are reminded of how it's just impossible for some people to be decent human beings! In this episode, we got into our role of being social justice judges and discussed a recent controversy surrounding an individual who was shamed by a local gym for offering to pay a smaller fee and to be the face of a training program in exchange to be part of it. We got into every detail of the exchange and shared our honest opinions on being entitled, treating your customers right and the importance of being decent and kind.

title: #62 Our Outrageous Hobbies, Should Hobbies Be Your Side Hustle & Finding Happiness In Your Hobbies
description: Be it baking, assembling puzzles or levelling up on your favourite game, hobbies are something we find joy in but what happens when our finance, emotions and happiness are at stake at the expense of our hobbies? In this episode, we share our hobbies, our thoughts on whether hobbies do actually bring you happiness and Ming Han reveals how he spent 5 digits worth of money on claw machines!

title: #61 Our Thoughts on Youtube Drama, "Cringeworthy" Content & Local Content Being Unappreciated
description: Over the past week, there was a lot of discussion over local Youtube content in Singapore which sparked a debate about how local content is undervalued by local viewers. We dive deep into this topic from our perspective as fellow content creators and talk about the unseen discipline needed to curate content, juggling between making content that works and making content you're passionate about and also the need to support your local creators.

title: #60 Of Scams, Hoaxes and Controversies That Happened During MCO
description: From Aliff Syukri's RM25 face mask to the boy who claimed he was offered a NASA scholarship and a whole marketing controversy around a peanut butter brand, we cover every scam, hoax and controversy that has happened thus far in Malaysia.

title: #59 Moving Out Of Your Family Home, The Reality Of Living Alone & Knowing When You’re Ready
description: Growing up in an Asian household pretty much means you're tied to staying at your family's home until you either (1) start a family of your own or (2) move out for studies or work. But let's be real, who hasn't dreamed of living on their own free from the watchful eye of their parents? In this episode, we weigh in on the idea of moving out from our parent's home, set out a realistic look of actually living alone and how to tell if you're financially and emotionally ready to be out on your own.

title: #58 The Guilt Of Not Being Productive, Negativity Of Comparison & Focusing On What Matters
description: With the rise of people using social media to document what they're cooking, their workout routine of the day, or a new skill they've picked up, we can't help but sometimes feel an inkling of guilt because we're not doing just as much with our lives. In this episode, we discuss productivity guilt, why it's toxic to compare our productivity to others and the need to shift our focus to our own wellbeing instead!

title: #57 The New Normal, Recognizing Your Privilege and How We Are Surviving As A Business
description:
We're one month into the MCO and as put by our PM, it's time to get used to "The New Normal". In this episode, we dive into what the new normal could be and how this will change the way we live, how us and many other local businesses are coping with the current economy and the importance of recognizing your privilege during this period. On a non-MCO related topic, we also addressed PETA's article on Animal Crossing (a video game) being not vegan. Truly, what a time to be alive.

Here's the link to the article Ming Yue was referencing: https://www.warc.com/newsandopinion/opinion/social-class-is-key-in-asias-new-marketing-reality/3497

title: #56 Podcasting From Home, A Total Recap of the MCO and Calling Out Ignorance
description: With the extension of MCO, we knew it was important to keep the show running so welcome to the home edition of Table Talk Podcast!  We're kicking off our first episode from home with a recap of what has happened so far during the MCO. We shared our thoughts on the good, bad and ugly that has come out of MCO, the need to support our local businesses and questioned why women were supposed to sound like Doraemon.

title: #55 Working with Family & Friends, Balancing The Dynamic & Maintaining Both Relationships (ft.Raj Mahal)
description: It's no secret that both Ming Han and Ming Yue are brothers and have been working together for almost a decade and sometimes personal relationships can get in the way of work. Raj Mahal joins us on this episode to discuss the dynamic between balancing a professional relationship and the relationship outside of work and making sure the line isn't overstepped.

title: #54 High School Life, Hanging Out With The Headmistress & Finding Poop In The Bag (ft. Desmond)
description: You know it's gonna be a good one when Desmond joins us for an episode! In this episode, we share stories about the shenanigans we got into during our time in high school! Oh yeah, this episode may or may not involve a lot of poop stories.

title: #53 #StayAtHome, Our Thoughts On MCO and Ways To Get Through It
description: How is it going, fam? We shot this episode literally a day before the movement control order (MCO) started and fast forward to almost a week later, times are indeed getting tough but we’ll get through this! In this episode, we talk about our reaction to the MCO, the panic buying, misinformation that followed and suggested ways for you to get through this time!

title: #52 Is Sugar Really Bad For You, Debunking Health Myths & Being Healthy Malaysians
description: There's no better time to take steps to leading a healthy lifestyle than NOW! In this episode we talk to Jowynna Yeo, a practicing dietician and Mei Ching, a nutritionist from Nestle about all things health! We debunk health myths like whether cutting carbs will actually help you lose weight and if sugar actually isn't as bad as you think! We also shared tips on how to read nutritional labels and also how to eat healthier!

title: #51 Social Vigilantism, Harnessing Hope & Being A Good Rakyat
description: The past month has been a pretty wild ride for Malaysians because of the sudden shift in our political scene. This has kept everyone on their toes and has unfortunately caused more negativity among the people. In this (rather serious) episode of Table Talk, we talk about the rise social vigilantism on the Internet, reigniting hope in the nation and ways to curb negativity by being a good rakyat!

title: #50 Our 50th Episode, Answering Your Burning Questions & What's Next!
description: Put your hands together for Table Talk's 50th episode! Sit with us as we reflect on our journey so far, answer some of your burning questions, reveal the faces behind The Takeaway Table and share what's next for us! We didn't think we'd make it to the big 50 but hey it's only possible thanks to all of you who stuck around! Here's to another 50!

title: #49 What Type of Travellers Are We, Raj Saw (***) In The Toilet & Travel Nightmares (ft. Raj Mahal)
description: Travelling abroad is all fun and games until things turn for the unexpected and everything goes downhill. In this episode, Raj Mahal; your local well travelled man, joins us on this episode to talk about travel nightmares! We talk about what type of travellers are we, our multiple unfortunate encounters with poop and all our travel nightmares during our adventures abroad!

title: #48 Our Biggest Regrets, Setting New Goals & Reminiscing Our Grandparents (ft. The Fashion Weak)
description: This episode is a crazy one because we got Arnold and Lucas from The Fashion Weak Podcast with us! We share what our biggest regrets in life are (Arnold regrets not being a Youtuber?!), talk about how much of a whirlwind January was and we set goals and changes we wish to achieve in 2020! Yes, we know it's February and we promise this will be our last time talking about resolutions! Oh, and we also reminisce about our grandparents - maybe a bit too much.

title: #47 Why Ikea Dates Are The Best, Getting Frisky At The Cinema & Valentine's Day Antics (ft. Desmond)
description: Brace yourself for the cheesiest time of the year - Valentine's Day! We sit down with your favourite Penang boy, Desmond to talk about Valentine's Day, whether we think it's overrated or not, debate on why dates at Ikea are the best and Desmond shares his confirm 100% can work tactic at the cinema. Tell us what other topics you want us to talk about below!

title: #46 How We Got Our Jobs, Ming Han Wanted To Be Ultraman & Nailing Job Interviews (ft. Raj Mahal)
description: Remember when you were asked what your ambition was when you were in primary school? We're gonna be unpacking all that with Raj Mahal and let you guys in on how we ended up getting our current jobs! We also talk about finding out what you wanna do, why you should separate your passion with your job and how to nail job interviews! Remember to tag us on @thetakeawaytable if you're listening!

title: #45 Chinese New Year Taboos, Dealing with Aunties and Uncles & Throwing Oranges (ft. The Penang Boys)
description: Happy Chinese New Year! It's that time of the year where we bring out our red clothes, get ready to be stuffed with good food and bring out the HUAT in us! In this episode, we sit down with your favourite Penang Boys to talk about taboos and traditions during Chinese New Year, how to deal with aunties and uncles who know no boundaries and share our plans for Chinese New Year. Tell us how you're spending Chinese New Year and tag us on @thetakeawaytable!

title: #44 Stepping Out Of Your Comfort Zone, Burn Out & Making The Change (with Maggy Wang)
description: Have you asked yourself, "If not now, when?" Stepping out of your comfort zone is never easy especially with all the possible consequences that come along with it. We got Maggy with us on this episode to talk about taking a chance on yourself and taking on challenges you normally wouldn't. We share our experiences, talk about burning out and why sometimes making the change is necessary!

title: #43 Realistic Resolutions, Being Better Humans & Embracing Your Weakness
description: In this episode, we dive deep into making realistic resolutions - and by that we mean when you’re not making resolutions just for the ‘gram or for show because we’re having none of that in 2020! We also talk about holding yourself accountable to your goals and how to achieve them while being better humans and embracing your weaknesses!

title: #41 More Than Influencers & The Shift in Malaysia's Entertainment Scene (ft. Melissa Campbell & Harvinth Skin)
description: Melissa Campbell and Harvinth Skin from Kopitiam Double Shot (a reboot of the classic sitcom, Kopitiam!) joins us for this podcast to talk about the sitcom, how they landed their roles in the reboot of this beloved classic and the shift in our entertainment industry. With Melissa coming from acting school and Harvinth discovering acting from being a content creator, we discuss the controversial topic of whether influencers can be considered actors and what this means for the future of our entertainment industry, all in all while unpacking the enigma from across the border that is Singapore Social.

title: #40 Finding Work-Life Balance, Snowflake Generation and Being Intentional About Life (ft. Mei Ling)
description: In this day and age, it's definitely not easy to find work-life balance especially with how fast-paced everything has become. We talk to Mei Ling, who we think has mastered the art of work-life balance to learn how to unplug from the stresses of work and life and how we should be intentional about  giving ourselves the rest we deserve. We also talk about the rise of the snowflake generation and how the hustle has changed over the years.

title: #39 Starting Your Own Business, Pursuing Your Passion and Facing The Struggles That Comes With It (ft. Ivan Lim of HouSek)
description: Ever thought of leaving your day job to start your own business? Saying goodbye to a well-paying job to start on something that might not pay off? Is it worth it? We talk to Ivan Lim, founder of HouSek (home of salted egg yolk fish skin, chips and other yummy snacks too!) about his journey to starting HouSek, what it's REALLY like to run your own business and the struggles, sacrifices and rewards that comes with it.

title: #38 Is College Necessary & Figuring Out What's Next In Life (ft. Desmond & Matthew)
description: Is college really necessary? What happens if we don't pursue college? Is it really the end?! This week's topic is suggested by one of our listeners (@dylanlzf) who wanted to know if college is a good choice in life and what happens when college isn't an option? We sit down with our favourite Penang boys, Desmond and Matthew to share their experiences with college and if it's really necessary in life! Feel free to send in your topic suggestions to us on our platforms and we might talk about it in the next episode!

title: #37 The History of Charlie Lim, Being A Notti Boi & Creative Struggles (ft. Charlie Lim)
description: We sit down with one of the most progressive and talented artists in the region - Singapore's nottiboi Charlie Lim during his stop here in KL for Urbanscapes! We chat about his journey of discovering himself through music, the struggles of being too critical of yourself, as well as what the future holds for him as an artist.

title: #36 Breaking up The Sam Willows, Life Comedy & Solo Music? (ft. Benjamin Kheng)
description: What happens when Benjamin Kheng happens to be in KL for 2 hours and has nothing to do? Well, this! Join us for a fun and random episode with Ben as we catch up with him on his venture to comedy, finally getting his solo music out and if he's really the reason why The Sam Willows broke up!

title: #35 Keeping up with Hirzi, Stealing a Sam Willow & Going Solo
description:
Give it up for Singapore's Internet legend, comedian, master storyteller, national treasure and all around icon - Hirzi! 

We sat down with the one and only Hirzi and caught up with him on his whereabouts after closing the chapter of MunahHirzi (or did they...?), starting a new comedy project with Benjamin Kheng while navigating through the scene of stand-up comedy, his future plans and how to reinvent and be the best version of yourself!

title: #34 Sucks Being Single? Single Forever? (ft. Desmond & Vivian)
description: Single vs. Dating vs. Married - chances are, you're going through one of these stages in life right now but let's be real, being single is probably the least fun out the three. Ming Yue sits down with Desmond and Vivian to talk about what it's like to be single, and the expectations and struggles that comes with it and how can one embrace their singlehood!

title: #33 Is This Goodbye? (ft. Tiara)
description: On this episode, we're joined by our showrunner, Tiara to talk about taking the leap of faith to pursue our dreams.

title: #32 Haunted House Hauntings, Spooky Celebrations, and Screams
description:
Hide under your covers and dim the lights because it's about to get real spooky as we gear up for Halloween! We got Mel (@heymelbelle) on this episode to talk about our favourite horror movies, supernatural encounters and what makes us shiver in fear! 

Make sure you check out netflix.com/streamandscream for more horror-rific movies and series to watch this Halloween!

title: #31 Penang Girls, Food, Drivers and Dreams
description: This week, we sit down with our resident Penang boys, Desmond and Matthew to share the "dirty" details about Penang.

title: #30 Resetting The Ming Thing
description: On this episode, we look back at how The Ming Thing has grown over the years and we also explain why hitting the reset button was necessary.

title: #29 Do Girls Game? (ft. ShuFaye)
description: In this episode, we chat with DOTA 2 streamer, Shu Faye Wong about what it's like being a girl, a gamer, a streamer and a positive influence to her online audience.

title: #28 Sharing the Stage with K-Pop Idols
description: We talk about passion, the local kpop dance cover scene, and how dancing has opened up a brand new world for Kueendom and Kingsman!

title: #27 What's the Deal with Jinnyboy?
description: On this episode, we unpack Jinnyboy of JinnyboyTV's history and more.

title: #26 Dealing with a Toxic Workplace (ft. Dr. Goh)
description: We sit down with former dean of HELP University's Faculty of Behavioral Sciences' Dr. Goh to discuss toxicity in the workplace.

title: #25 Is It Ok to Date Your Friend's Ex? (ft. Melissa Campbell)
description: On this episode, we're joined by Melissa Campbell to answer some of your questions about dating and relationships.

title: #24 When Will AI Takeover (ft. Jovy Low)
description: We sit down with cinephilia, Jovy Low to discuss the topic of Artificial Intelligence and where it's headed.

title: #23 Overcoming Yourself (ft. Sezairi)
description: This episode, we speak to singer-songwriter and award winner Sezairi Sezali about his journey in the world of music and arts.

title: #22 Getting Real with Jane & Daphne (ft. Jane Chuck & Daphne Charice)
description: In this episode, we discuss with special guests and bloggers Jane Chuck and Daphne Charice about assumptions, expectations, and the hustle for what's next.

title: #21 Do Influencers Influence Less? (ft. Harvinth Skin)
description: This week, we sit down with Harvinth Skin to discuss about our local influencers and their influence.

title: #20 Why Does K-Pop Work?
description: This week, we discuss what is it about K-pop that makes it such a global phenomenon.

title: #19 Meeting Our Heroes (ft. Natalie Chai)
description: On this episode, we chat with Natalie Chai about what it's like meeting our celebrity heroes in person.

title: #18 Jack of All Trades or A Master of One?
description: This week, we're discussing whether it's better to focus on working on our weaknesses, or improving our strengths.

title: #17 Are We Doing This Travel Thing Right? (ft. Nadir Nahdi)
description: Are we obsessed with traveling? What's wrong with having wanderlust? Are we living life just for the 'Gram? We unpack these questions with Nadir in this Tabletalk episode!

title: #16 Conversations with Dad (ft. Uncle Ho)
description: On this Father's Day special, we sat down with our dad to answer some hard questions about life, love and passion

title: #15 What's The Point of Dating? (ft. Melissa Campbell & Tiara Anchant)
description: This week, we're speaking to special guests Melissa Campbell and Tiara Anchant about dating and commitment.

title: #14 He Annoys Me! (ft. Maggy Wang & Joseph Lee)
description: This week, together with special guests Maggy and Joseph, we discuss what our pet peeves are and how we deal with them.

title: #13 How to Get Over a Bad Day (ft. Maggy Wang & Joseph Lee)
description: On this episode, we discuss with host, Maggy Wang and fitness coach, Joseph Lee ways to get over a bad day.

title: #12 What Do You Look Forward to in Life
description: On this episode, we discuss the little joys in life that we look forward to.

title: #11 How to Kao Lui (ft. Koe Yeet)
description: We discuss the art of flirting with local actress Koe Yeet!

title: #10 Passion, Hard Work & What's REALLY Worth It (ft Steven Lim)
description: We talk passion, hard work and what's really worth it with Steven Lim.

title: #9 End Game April
description: This week, we're getting excited for Avengers: Infinity War and Game of Thrones!

title: #8 Buying Gifts For Guys/ Girls (ft. Melissa Campbell)
description: On this week's episode, we discuss how to choose a thoughtful gift for someone.

title: #7 Who Is a Real Friend?
description: This week, we tackle what it means to be a real friend.

title: #6 April Fools' & Childhood Pranks (ft. Melissa Campbell)
description: An April Fools special featuring Melissa Campbell where we talk childhood pranks gone wrong.

title: #5 Music, Life & Love (ft. SoImJenn and Jon Liddell)
description: How do we maintain relationships both online and offline.

title: #4 Getting Real - The Sacrifice of Social Media
description: Is there a point when our lives are ever really offline? We talk about the sacrifices when it comes to social media - for better or worse.

title: #3 Getting Real - Is The Influencer Life Worth It?
description: Is living for social media worth it? We unpack the question with Bellywellyjelly & Bella Kuan.

title: #2 Getting Real - Surviving Social Media
description: How does one survive social media? Is there a kit? Are there cookies? Come unpack this fat one with us!

title: #1: Getting Real - How We REALLY Got Started on Social Media
description: We answer one of the most common questions we've received: "How did you start?".
